item.title: Notenik Turns the Big Five-O!
item.description: Yes, that's right – Notenik version 5.0.0 has just been released, in all likelihood closing the books on 2020. So this feels like a good time to take a breather and look back on the path we've traveled, along with new routes yet to explore.

item.title: Current Best Practices for Notenik Web Generation
item.description: My current recommendations for those just starting to use Notenik to generate a website.

item.title: Evolving Use of Notenik for Web Generation
item.description: Some history about how my latest thinking has evolved.

item.title: Additional Updates to Notenik - November 4, 2020
item.description: I've made a bunch of Notenik improvements since my last blog post, and I attempt to summarize them here.

item.title: Recent Updates to Notenik - March, 2020
item.description: A summary of notable changes to the Mac App since December, 2019.

item.title: Using Notenik with Existing Text Files
item.description: Since Notenik is rather late to the game of managing text files, and since those already using similar sorts of files are probably among those interested in my app, I wanted to talk a bit about how the latest version of Notenik can be used with existing folders full of text files.

item.title: The Thinking Behind the Notenik File Format
item.description: People have been storing notes in text files long before Notenik came along. So why is the Notenik format different?

item.title: Notenik for the Mac Versions 2.5.0 and 2.6.0 Released
item.description: Version 2.6.0 was focused on strengthening support for opening folders full of existing text files and handling them smoothly as Notenik Collections.

item.title: Notenik for the Mac Version 2.4.0 Released
item.description: Most of the changes for this release were focused on providing the capability for wiki-like inter-note linking.

item.title: Notenik for the Mac Version 2.3.0 Released
item.description: Fixed treatment of the Teaser field, to treat it as a long text field; increased tolerance for Notes with alternative formatting; added Ink as an alternate for parsing of Markdown; added an optional Timestamp field, as a first step to enabling use of Notenik to create a Zettelkasten.
